title: Man Pleads Guilty , Sentenced to 14 Years for DHS Hotel Stabbing
message:
A man pleaded guilty Wednesday to assault and burglary charges for his role in a stabbing at a Desert Hot Springs hotel and was immediately sentenced to 14 years in prison.
Anthony Rene Ayala, 30, pleaded guilty before Judge Jason Stone at the Larson Justice Center in Indio to assault causing great bodily injury and first-degree burglary, according to Riverside County District Attorney’s office spokesman John Hall.
Two other men charged in the case, 30-year-old Jose Luis Garcia and 32-year-old Moises Mazariegos, previously pleaded guilty to the same charges.
The stabbing occurred around 11 p.m. April 15, 2021, at a hotel in the 11000 block of Palm Drive, according to the Desert Hot Springs Police Department.
Ayala has two robbery convictions, Garcia has convictions for burglary and attempted robbery, and Reynaga and Mazariegos have convictions for burglary and robbery.

message:
CNN —The war in Gaza will likely continue through at least the end of the year, an Israeli official warned Wednesday, seeming to dismiss the idea that fighting would end after the military offensive against Hamas in Rafah.
Israel’s national security adviser, Tzachi Hanegbi, said the year 2024 has been “defined as a year of combat” by Israel’s war cabinet.

The two Koreas' large militaries face off across the military border and North Korea routinely threatens to annihilate its neighbor.

title: At 100 , this vet says the  greatest generation  moniker fits  because we saved the world . – Winnipeg Free Press
message:
SERVICE: Army’s 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion, 6th Armored Division.
World War II veteran Andy Negra sits in his home in Helen, Ga, on April 10, 2024.
He shows a photo of himself during his time with the Army's 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion, 6th Armored Division.
(AP Photo/Sharon Johnson)“BECAUSE WE SAVED THE WORLD”It was 1943, and Andrew “Andy” Negra Jr. had just finished high school.
He shows a photo of himself during his time with the Army's 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion, 6th Armored Division.
event_breakdown:
Andy Negra, 96, recalled the time he was drafted into the U.S. Army in 1944 during World War II. He was assigned to the 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion of the 6th Armored Division. 

"I was 18 years old," said Negra, now a resident of Helen, Ga. "I didn't know what exactly war was all about."

In October 1943, Negra was among several draftees who boarded a train in New York City bound for Camp Fannin, Texas, the starting point for basic training. The 128th AFA Battalion was part of the 6th AD, a formation of mechanized infantry, tank and artillery units known for their effectiveness during World War II.

Negra's unit was equipped with 155mm self-propelled assault guns, known as "armored guns." Equipped with a .50-caliber machine gun and directed by a five-man crew, these were much like the tanks that accompanied them.

"We'd go from point A to point B, depending on where we were," Negra said during a March 31 interview at the Unicoi State Park and Lodge in Helen. "We were mainly there to support the infantry on their advances, so basically we were like assault artillery."

Part of the 6th AD, the 128th AFA Battalion was stationed near Paris and fought in the Battle of the Bulge. Negra's unit was among those ordered to relieve the 101st Airborne Division, which was surrounded in the Belgian city of Bastogne. Negra said the 6th AD headed north toward Belgium

title: One killed after hand grenade explodes during Japan SDF training
message:
Tokyo, May 30 : A member of Japan's Self-Defense Forces (SDF) on Thursday died over a hand grenade explosion during a training session in Yamanashi Prefecture, immediately west of Tokyo, according to local media reports.
The accident took place around 8.45 a.m. local time at the Ground Self-Defense Force (GSDF)'s training ground Kitafuji Exercise Area, where a 29-year-old male soldier taking part in the training was hit by shrapnel from a hand grenade thrown by another SDF member, reports Xinhua news agency.
In recent years, the SDF has had frequent reports of training casualties.
A shooting incident at a GSDF shooting range in Gifu Prefecture killed an SDF member and injured two others in June last year.
Two Maritime SDF helicopters in April collided and crashed during a night-time anti-submarine drill, killing one and leaving seven others missing.

Gaza medical sources said the 12 Palestinians, whom it said were civilians, had been killed and an unspecified number of others wounded in an Israeli airstrike as they tried to recover the body of a civilian in the centre of Rafah.

Gaza medical sources said the 12 Palestinians, whom it said were civilians, had been killed and an unspecified number of others wounded in an Israeli airstrike as they tried to recover the body of a civilian in the centre of Rafah.
